Package model

Interface Model

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModelImpl
    public interface Model
    This interface is the model interface for the Stocks application. This has various function descriptions for the user inputted stock values. These methods call various other methods to carry out the tasks as requested by the controller. It has methods which handle validations, writing, composition, total etc. m

    • Method Detail

      • writePortfolioName

        void writePortfolioName​(java.lang.String pfName,
                        java.lang.String filePath)
        This function writes the user inputted portfolio name into the XML file. This method in the model will receive the portfolio name and the file path where this name has to be saved from the controller.
        Parameters:
        pfName - Portfolio Name(String), that was entered by the user in the text-based UI
        filePath - path of the XML file where the Portfolio Name will be placed. This is an absolute path.

      • checkIfCanSell

        boolean checkIfCanSell​(java.lang.String pfName,
                       java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
                       double numShares,
                       java.lang.String filePath,
                       java.time.LocalDate date)
        This function writes the user inputted portfolio name into the XML file. This method in the model will receive the portfolio name and the file path where this name has to be saved from the controller.
        Parameters:
        pfName - Portfolio Name(String), that was entered by the user in the text-based UI
        tickerSymbol - ticker symbol (String) that represents the company for which the user is interested in investing.
        numShares - number of shares (int) that the user invested for a given tickersymbol
        filePath - path of the XML file where the Portfolio Name will be placed. This is an absolute path.
        date - (LocalDate) date that is denoted in the LocalDate format
        Returns:
        true if the user can sell the stocks

      • writeStockDetails

        void writeStockDetails​(java.lang.String pfName,
                       java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
                       double numShares,
                       double commFee,
                       java.lang.String filePath,
                       java.time.LocalDate date)
        This function writes the user inputted stock details into the XML file. This method in the model will receive the portfolio name to which the ticker symbol(s) and the number of shares will be bounded and saved in the xml at the file path.
        Parameters:
        pfName - Portfolio Name(String), that was entered by the user in the text-based UI
        tickerSymbol - ticker symbol (String) that represents the company for which the user is interested in investing.
        numShares - number of shares (int) that the user invested for a given tickersymbol
        filePath - path of the XML file where the stock details will be placed. This is an absolute path.
        date - (LocalDate) date that is denoted in the LocalDate format

      • getComposition

        java.lang.String getComposition​(java.lang.String pfNameComp,
                                java.lang.String filePath,
                                java.time.LocalDate date)
        This function gets the portfolio composition from the XML. To get the portfolio, this method should receive the portfolio name and the path of the file where that particular portfolio was saved.
        Parameters:
        pfNameComp - Composition for the portfolio to be retrieved (String)
        filePath - path of the XML file where the stock details will be available. This is an absolute path.
        date - (LocalDate) date that is denoted in the LocalDate format
        Returns:
        a string which contains all the portfolio details (name, stocks, number of shares)

      • getTotal

        double getTotal​(java.lang.String pfNameTotal,
                java.lang.String filePath,
                java.time.LocalDate date,
                java.lang.String type)
        This function gets the total of shares for a given portfolio from an XML file. To calculate the total of a portfolio this model should receive the name of the portfolio, a hashmap which contains a key value pair of stocks and their prices on a specific date (date entered by the user) and the file path from where it will read the number of shares.
        Parameters:
        pfNameTotal - Total for the portfolio to be retrieved (String)
        filePath - path of the XML file where the stock details will be available. This is an absolute path.
        date - (LocalDate) date that is denoted in the LocalDate format
        Returns:
        a double value which contains the total value of the portfolio

      • isPfNameUnique

        boolean isPfNameUnique​(java.lang.String pfName,
                       java.lang.String filePath)
        This function checks if the given portfolio name is unique, if not it will return false to the controller.
        Parameters:
        pfName - Portfolio Name(String), that was entered by the user in the text-based UI
        filePath - path of the XML file where the stock details will be available. This is an absolute path.
        Returns:
        true if portfolio name is unique (and hence valid) else will return false

      • getCostBasis

        double getCostBasis​(java.lang.String pfNameTotal,
                    java.lang.String filePath,
                    java.time.LocalDate date)
        This function gets the cost basis for a given portfolio. To calculate the cost basis of a portfolio, this model should receive the name of the portfolio, a hashmap which contains a key value pair of stocks and their prices on a specific date (date entered by the user) and the file path from where it will read the number of shares.
        Parameters:
        pfNameTotal - Total for the portfolio to be retrieved (String)
        filePath - path of the XML file where the stock details will be available. This is an absolute path.
        date - (LocalDate) date that is denoted in the LocalDate format
        Returns:
        a double value which contains the total value of the portfolio

      • isTickerSymbolValid

        boolean isTickerSymbolValid​(java.lang.String tickerSymbol)
        This function checks if the ticker symbol is a valid symbol. A valid ticker symbol is the one which is available in the master list of the stock names.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - ticker symbol (String) that represents the company for which the user is interested in investing.
        Returns:
        true if ticker symbol is available in the master list, else return false

      • checkValidFilePath

        boolean checkValidFilePath​(java.lang.String filePath)
        This function checks if the given file exists and the file path is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path of the XML file that the user wants to upload. This is an absolute path.
        Returns:
        false if the file path is valid, else will return true

      • isNumberOfSharesValid

        boolean isNumberOfSharesValid​(java.lang.String num)
        This method checks if the number of shares entered by the user are fractional or not. It should return false if fractional shares are entered.
        Parameters:
        num - is the number of shares
        Returns:
        true if it is integer, else will return false

      • isDateValid

        boolean isDateValid​(java.lang.String date,
                    java.lang.String purpose,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDate> datesFromAPI)
        This method checks if the date entered by the user are valid or not. It should return false if invalid dates are entered.
        Parameters:
        date - (String) date formatted as a String.
        Returns:
        true if it is integer, else will return false.

      • getPerformanceGraph

        java.lang.StringBuilder getPerformanceGraph​(java.lang.String pfNameGraph,
                                            java.lang.String filePath,
                                            java.time.LocalDate date1,
                                            java.time.LocalDate date2,
                                            java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDate> validDatesInAPI)
        Checks whether the dats is valid or not. A valid date for creation and modification is a date which is in yyyy-MM-dd format and the stock market is open on that day.
        Parameters:
        pfNameGraph - portfolio name.
        filePath - path of the file where portfolio is saved
        date1 - start date of the graph.
        date2 - end date of the graph.
        validDatesInAPI - dates on which market is opened.
        Returns:
        a stringbuilder which has the performance graph for the text based UI.

      • isInvestmentAmtValid

        boolean isInvestmentAmtValid​(java.lang.String invtAmt)
        Checks whether the investment amount is in valid format.
        Parameters:
        invtAmt - investment amount entered by the user.
        Returns:
        true if investment amount in valid.

      • isCommFeeValid

        boolean isCommFeeValid​(java.lang.String commFee)
        Checks whether the commission fee entered by the user is in valid format.
        Parameters:
        commFee - commission fee for that particular transaction.
        Returns:
        returns true if commission fee is of valid format.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        investment amount (double).

        double getCommFee​(java.lang.String commFee)
        Returns the commission fee in double.
        Parameters:
        commFee - commission fee for the particular transaction.
        Returns:
        the commission fee (double)

      • isPercentageValid

        boolean isPercentageValid​(java.lang.String perc)
        Checks whether the percentage entered by the user is in valid format. An invalid percentage is a non positive number.
        Parameters:
        perc - percentage of investment amount to be put for a particular stock.
        Returns:
        true if percentage is valid.

      • getPercentage

        double getPercentage​(java.lang.String perc)
        Returns the percentage from string to double format.
        Parameters:
        perc - percentage of investment amount to be put for a particular stock.
        Returns:
        percentage (double)

      • isIntervalValid

        boolean isIntervalValid​(java.lang.String interval)
        Checks whether the interval entered by the user is in valid format. An invalid interval is a non positive integer.
        Parameters:
        interval - interval in which user wants investments to happen in dollar cost average.
        Returns:
        returns true if interval is of valid format.

      • getInterval

        int getInterval​(java.lang.String interval)
        Returns the interval for DCA in int format.
        Parameters:
        interval - The interval in which the user wants investments to happen in case of dollar cost averaging.
        Returns:
        converts the intervals from string to int format.

      • getTickerSymbol

        java.lang.String getTickerSymbol​(java.lang.String ts)
        Returns the ticker symbol.
        Parameters:
        ts - ticker symbol entered by the user
        Returns:
        returns the ticker symbol

      • isStartDateValid

        boolean isStartDateValid​(java.lang.String strDate)
        Checks whether the start date for dollar cost averaging is valid or not. A valid start date is a date which is in yyyy-MM-dd format.
        Parameters:
        strDate - date in string format
        Returns:
        true if date is valid

      • isEndDateValid

        boolean isEndDateValid​(java.lang.String strDate,
                       java.time.LocalDate startDate)
        Checks whether the end date for dollar cost averaging is valid or not. A valid end date is a date which is in yyyy-MM-dd format and greater than the start date.
        Parameters:
        strDate - date in string format
        startDate - start date entered by the user for graph or DCA.
        Returns:
        true if date is valid.

      • getDate

        java.time.LocalDate getDate​(java.lang.String strDate)
        Returns the date in the LocalDate format.
        Parameters:
        strDate - date in string format.
        Returns:
        converts string to LocalDate.

      • saveTsAndPerc

        void saveTsAndPerc​(java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
                   double percentage)
        Adds the stocks and the percentage of the investment amount to a map in cases where the user wants to create portfolio by investing money instead of specifying exact number of shares.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - stock to be invested into.
        percentage - percentage of money to be invested in the said stock.

      • resetTsAndPerc

        void resetTsAndPerc()
        Resets the map of stocks and the percentage of the investment amount in case the user wants to create portfolio by investing money instead of specifying exact number of shares.

      • dollarCostAveraging

        void dollarCostAveraging​(java.lang.String pfName,
                         double invtAmt,
                         double commFee,
                         java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                         java.time.LocalDate endDate,
                         int intervals,
                         java.lang.String filePath,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDate> validDates,
                         java.lang.String purpose)
        Incorporates the dollar cost averaeg strategy. Calculates the timestamps and the number of stock to be registered in a portfolio depending on the investment amount and the percentage split up of this amount into various stocks. Saves the investment strategy in a portfolio on each interval between the start and end date (as provided by the user).
        Parameters:
        pfName - portfolio name of the portfolio to be created/ modified.
        invtAmt - investment amount provided by the user
        commFee - commission fee per transaction
        startDate - start date of the investment strategy
        endDate - end date of the investment strategy
        intervals - intervals in which the user wants to automatically buy stocks.
        filePath - path of the file where portfolio details will be saved.
        validDates - dats on which the market is open for the buying to take place.
        purpose - whether portfolio is being created or modified using this strategy.

      • getNumberOfShares

        double getNumberOfShares​(java.lang.String numShares)
        Converts the number of shares from string format to integer format.
        Parameters:
        numShares - number of shares user wants to buy
        Returns:
        the number of shares as an integer

      • isPercentagesSum100

        boolean isPercentagesSum100()
        Checks whether the user has invested 100% of his money.
        Returns:
        true if user has invested 100% of his money.

      • percentageSumMoreThan100

        boolean percentageSumMoreThan100​(double percentage)
        Checks whether the percentage of money to be invested has crossed 100 or not.
        Parameters:
        percentage - percentage of money to be put in a stock
        Returns:
        true if user is trying to invest more than 100% of his investment amount.

      • getStockList

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getStockList()
        Gets a list of all the stocks supported by this system.
        Returns:
        an arraylist of all the supported stocks.

      • getAxisForGraph

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getAxisForGraph​(java.lang.String pfNameGraph,
                                                                            java.lang.String filePath,
                                                                            java.time.LocalDate date1,
                                                                            java.time.LocalDate date2,
                                                                            java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDate> validDatesInAPI)
        Calculates the timestamps and the total value on that timestamp for plotting the graph. Returns a hashmap whose key value pair acts as x-y axis on the graph on GUI.
        Parameters:
        pfNameGraph - portfolio name whose graph is to plotted.
        filePath - path of the file where portfolio details are available.
        date1 - start date of the graph.
        date2 - end date of the graph.
        validDatesInAPI - valid dates from api.
        Returns:
        a hashmap with timestamp and value as a key value pair.
